title: Dozens of Federal Judges Had Financial Conflicts: What You Need to Know
sub_head: A Wall Street Journal investigation finds 131 federal judges unlawfully ruled in cases involving companies in which they or their families held shares
body:
A Wall Street Journal investigation found that federal judges around the nation have violated U.S. law and judicial ethics by overseeing more than 950 court cases involving companies in which they or their family owned stock.
As a result of the Journalâ€™s reporting, judges in 777 cases have notified courts that they presided in the lawsuits improperly and that the cases are eligible to be reopened.
